title: Benedictine Dip Recipe
description: Benedictine dip is a Kentucky Derby party staple — and this one requires simple ingredients and is easy to make ahead, chill, and serve when your guests arrive!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Recipes Cheese Dips and Spreads Recipes Benedictine Dip 5.0 (1) 1 Review 2 Photos A simple Derby Day appetizer dip my aunt, who lived in Louisville, gave to my mother over 50 years ago. Serve with crackers or chips. Submitted by Susie Published on January 10, 2015 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 2 Prep Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 8 hrs 10 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese, softened 2 tablespoons mayonnaise 2 tablespoons finely grated onion 2 tablespoons finely grated peeled and seeded cucumber 1 drop green food coloring Directions Mix cream cheese, mayonnaise, onion, cucumber, and food coloring together in a bowl until well blended and food coloring is incorporated. Cover and chill, 8 hours to overnight. Serve. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Benedictine Dip 01 of 02 Photo by  Sheila LaLonde 02 of 02 Photo by  Sheila LaLonde 03/21/2022 I took this dip to a neighborhood party tonight and it was a huge hit! So simple with rave reviews! I adjusted the serving size to 16 to use an 8 oz brick of cream cheese. name: Susie
instructions: Mix cream cheese, mayonnaise, onion, cucumber, and food coloring together in a bowl until well blended and food coloring is incorporated. Cover and chill, 8 hours to overnight. Serve.
